intro: Calathiana nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, often in open meadows or along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in late summer. Calathiana nevadensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also of ecological significance to local wildlife.
